problem.markdown:
The situation is the same as in the previous section of the question except that now there is inspection of parts after they receive operations at \(M_1\). Assume that the inspection is perfect; that is, the inspection rejects every part that received a bad operation (10%) at \(M_1\) and it accepts every part that gets a good operation (90%). Assume also that the inspection time is 0 and ignore the cost of inspection.
>>What is the expected value of a part when it leaves the shop?<<
= 8910 [explanation] There are 3 kinds of parts that leave the shop: Parts that have been successfully processed at both machines. The value of these parts is $10,000+2($500). The probability of that is \((1-0.1)^2\). The other two kinds of parts have a defect at one of the two operations, thus have a value of 0. Therefore, the expected value is \(($10,000+2($500))(1-0.1)^2\). [explanation]
>>What is the expected increase of a part's value due to both operations?<<
= -1090 [explanation] This is the same as Part 2 [explanation] >>What is the production rate of good parts?<<
= 0.81 [explanation] This is the same as Part 2 [explanation]
